ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: The people who are closest to you in your peer group (the individuals with whom you spend recreational time, not parents) including spouses and significant others, indicate Person
Notes: 1 = Person 1 your CLOSEST relationship; 2 = Person 2 your SECOND closest relationship; 3 = Person 3 your THIRD closest relationship; 4 = Person 4 your FOURTH closest relationship

ElementDescription: Over the last year, how often does this person have a drink containing alcohol?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Monthly or less; 2 = 2-4 times/month; 3 = 2-3 times/week; 4 = 4 or more times/week

ElementDescription: Over the last year, how many drinks containing alcohol does this person have on a typical day when he or she is drinking?
Over the last year, how often does this person have six or more drinks on one occasion?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Monthly or less; 2 = 2-4 times/month; 3 = 2-3 times/week; 4 = Daily or almost daily

ElementDescription: What is this person's relationship to you?
Notes: 1 = Significant other/spouse; 2 = Friend; 3 = Relative

ElementDescription: How often does FRIEND 1 smoke tobacco cigarettes or cigars or use chewing tobacco?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Monthly or less; 2 = 2-4 times per month; 3 = 2-3 times weekly; 4 = 4 or more times per week

Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Monthly or less; 2 = 2-4 times per month; 3 = 2-3 times weekly; 4 = 4 or more times per week
